last_episode_to_air.name: Episode #26
last_episode_to_air.overview: The Final episode Cybergirl and her team finds a way to return power to the city and save the day?

name: Cybergirl
overview: Cybergirl is an Australian children's television series that first screened on Network Ten in Australia. The 26 episode series was created by Jonathan M. Shiff, whose previous series include the BAFTA-award-winning Ocean Girl. Cybergirl has also screened on ABC on 6:00am, Thursday and on other networks outside Australia. In 2007 it aired as Cy-An 6000 on the Kabillion on-demand network but no reason is given for the name change.

episodes.name: Episode #1
episodes.overview:
Cybergirl, a human prototype, crash lands on Earth and begins to find out what real humans are about.

With her own kind searching for her, she takes shelter with Jackson and his dad.

episodes.name: Episode #2
episodes.overview: Cybergirl knows that she has to do something in order to get the replicants off her trail. In order to do this, she has to ask a favour of Jackson and Hugh, and they have to agree - fast.

episodes.name: Episode #3
episodes.overview: Being almost completely blue does not help Cybergirl to 'blend in' to society, so a change of clothes is in order. Cybergirl also takes on the fake identity of Ashley, Jackson's cousin. However, will this change of appearance stop Xanda and Isaac from recognizing her?

episodes.name: Episode #4
episodes.overview: Cybergirl, as Ashley, has her first day in school. Kat is suspicious, however - how does Ashley know so much? Worse still, it transpires that Kat is the daughter of Rick Fontain, a sure fire way for Ashley's cover to be blown should Kat find out...

episodes.name: Episode #5
episodes.overview: Romirez is given a blue metal sphere with strange writing on it by a local farmer. He assigns Hugh to find out more about it. Cybergirl knows more, however: it was part of her ship. If Xanda and Isaac get their hands on it, they can use it to locate her. Kat uses this situation to prove herself as trustworthy...

episodes.name: Episode #6
episodes.overview: At school Cybergirl stands up for Jackson against the school bully. She thinks he'll thank her for it, but he's angry because afterall - who wants a girl defending them?

episodes.name: Episode #7
episodes.overview: Ashley and Jackson go on work experience at Top Dog Interactive - placing the answer to Rhyss' mystery so close to him is a dangerous thing....

episodes.name: Episode #8
episodes.overview: When Top Dog's mainframe dies, and Jackson, Kat and a bunch of school children become trapped in a lift, Cybergirl is forced to show herself in public to save them. Is her cover blown?

episodes.name: Episode #9
episodes.overview: Isaac and Xanda stage a bomb scare - they send Mick into the vault of the museum with a bomb, which he does not know about. Only Cybergirl can defuse the bomb, but in doing so she risks her own life...

episodes.name: Episode #10
episodes.overview:
Having run away from River City to protect her friends and adopted family, Ashley meets a farming family who are about to have a wedding. An argument could spoil the day however, and it is up to Ashley to settle matters.

Meanwhile, Jackson and Kat do all they can to find Ashley, but will they be successfull?

episodes.name: Episode #11
episodes.overview: Ashley accepts a bet from Jackson and Kat not to use her cyber powers for one week, but will she be able to keep it up when the media hype surrounding her increases dramatically?

episodes.name: Episode #12
episodes.overview:
After a brave rescue on her holiday, Cybergirl must run from Isaac and Xanda, the press, but also Rhyss, who is doing everything in his power to meet her. 

When alone in a room together, Rhyss tells Cybergirl of his plans, and requests Cybergirl's assistance in carrying them through...

episodes.name: Episode #13
episodes.overview: Fed up of constantly having to run and hide from Isaac and Xanda, Cybergirl decides it is time to confront them. However, these two Cyber Replicants have different plans...

episodes.name: Episode #14
episodes.overview: Ashley, Jackson and Kat relax in the mistaken belief that the Cyborgs have perished. In actual fact, they have been saved by Rhyss, a partnership that does not bode well for Cybergirl...

episodes.name: Episode #15
episodes.overview: When Rick and Honey Fontaine threaten to get rid of Ahab when he misbehaves, it is imperetive that Kat can get him to behave during a dinner party with Mayor Buxton. Ashley helps out, but she is also keen to find out what Rhyss is up to, and stop him...

episodes.name: Episode #16
episodes.overview: When Ashley succeeds in obtaining the role of Juliette in the school play, she secures the affections of Kevin. Only problem is, she isn't entirely sure what love is...

episodes.name: Episode #17
episodes.overview: While helping Jackson and Hugh at an archeological site, Ashley is struck by a strange sickness. Could it be the work of Rhyss?

episodes.name: Episode #18
episodes.overview: Rhyss stages a disaster in a local quarry to lure Cybergirl out of hiding. When she arrives, he uses the power of the Cybernet to disable and capture her...

episodes.name: Episode #19
episodes.overview: Rhyss has Cybergirl trapped in his house: she cannot escape, as he has modified the Cybernet to create a forcefield around the house, harmless to humans but impenetrable to computers. It's up to Jackson and Kat to save her...

episodes.name: Episode #20
episodes.overview:
When Jackson and Kat break a precious statue, it is up to Cybergirl to save Hugh from being fired. 

Meanwhile, Isaac and Xanda catch up with Rhyss, who is trying to leave the country to get away from them...

episodes.name: Episode #21
episodes.overview: When Rhyss invites teenagers from across River City to a dance, Cybergirl must be careful she doesn't blow her disguise as Ashley. Not easy, seeings as Rhyss has rigged the event with hundreds of CCTV cameras...

episodes.name: Episode #22
episodes.overview: Cybergirl has incriminating evidence against Rhyss - evidence that could destory his plans. In trying to broadcast it to the city, however, she comes across a problem: Rhyss has bought the station. With the media under his thumb, Rhyss seems unstopable...

episodes.name: Episode #23
episodes.overview: With Rick Fontain under his thumb, Rhyss creates a smear campaign to destory Cybergirl. Falsifying crime numbers, and blaming it on Cybergirl, it seems that Rhyss will succeed in destroying her, and taking absolute control of the city...

episodes.name: Episode #24
episodes.overview: Rhyss goes head to head in the elections against Mayor Buxton. Using lies and deceit, he gains the support of a huge number of people. Once he gains control of the city, there'll be no stopping him...

episodes.name: Episode #25
episodes.overview:
Rhys had just become major so everyone is making a big deal about it. Rhys made the Xanda the police chief and Isaac the fire chief, giving them complete control.

Cyber girl had gone to stop rhys and to talk to the old police commissioner, who is now a security guard and is almost caught, so is now on the run. An "Anti-cybergirl task force is set up" jackson.

The episode ends with Kat's dad telling the city what a charleton Rhys is, on the TV. Rhys was watching, started laughing maniacally and turns the cities power off, leaving it in darkness.

episodes.name: Episode #26
episodes.overview: The Final episode Cybergirl and her team finds a way to return power to the city and save the day?
